title: The Works of Robert Louis Stevenson - Swanston Edition, Vol. 16

snippet: The figure that always fixed myattention is that of Hackston of Rathillet, sitting in the saddle withhis cloak about his mouth, and through all that long, bungling,vociferous hurly-burly, revolving privately a case of conscience.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: After this bold'step, Cameron, being closelypursued, roamed through the more desolate placesof the counties of Dumfries and Ayr, with a fewfriends in arms, of whom Hackston of Rathillet,famous for his share in the death of ArchbishopSharpie, was the principal.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: This did not recall them totlieir senses ; they held a council, indeed, but itwas only to engage in a furious debate, whichlasted until Rathillet told them his sword wasdrawn, as well against those who accepted the Indulgence, as against the curates, and withdrewfrom the council after this defiance, followed bythose who professed his principles.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: David Hackston of Rathillet, who was woundedand made prisoner in the skirmish of Air's-moss, inwhich the celebrated Cameron fell, was, on enteringEdinburgh, "by order of the Council, received bythe Magistrates at the Watergate, and set on a horse'share back with his face to the tail, and the other threelaid on a goad of iron, and carried up the street, Mr.Cameron's head being on a halberd before them."
